abstracts.cdata!:
The Grand Trunk Road Project will
            improve the high traffic volumes traversing the Ganges
            Plains at the Agra-Barwa Adda corridor through the
            construction and expansion of roads and highways. However,
            project implementation will adversely impact the
            environment, causing air pollution (particularly endangering
            cultural heritage sites, i.e., the Taj Mahal), water
            pollution, and major crop losses. During the
            pre-construction and construction stages, measures to
            minimize adversity shall include clearance of the
            right-of-way, transplanting pre-identified trees, and
            replacing/relocating utilities likely to impact the
            livelihoods of the neighboring population. Debris shall be
            disposed of by the contractor at selected dump sites;
            topsoil shall be stockpiled to restore disturbed areas, and
            borrow pits shall be dug at road embankments. To prevent
            soil erosion, sedimentation, and water pollution, the use of
            dikes, sediment basins, and slope drains shall be used in
            accordance with engineering designs. Lubricants and oil
            spills shall be contained through oil interceptors for
            refueling cases with fuel storage at appropriate sites, and
            disposal of petroleum products in accordance with
            environmental guidelines. Spoils, and solid wastes shall be
            treated, and disposed of at selected disposal sites. Silt
            fencing and retention ponds will be installed to prevent
            water pollution and groundwater depletion.
